com.rshepard.blackjack.game

Class BlackJackGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rshepard.blackjack.game.BlackJackGame

  • public class BlackJackGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates the different states of a game of blackJack. I experimented with using the state machine design pattern

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Dealer dealer 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BlackJackGame()
      Creates a new blackjack instance and initializes all the possible states

        public boolean isBetValid()
        Returns:
        If the value of the bet is valid when compared to the player's remaining amount in their wallet

        Returns:
        The boolean indicating whether or not the game has been won

      • getPlayerScore

        public int getPlayerScore()
        Returns:
        Uses the Ranker class to check the score of the Player and returns an int value of the hand

      • getDealerScore

        public int getDealerScore()
        Returns:
        Uses the Ranker class to check the score of the Dealer and returns an int value of the hand

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        Begins a new game of blackjack inits the pot to zero and isWon to false and sets the current state to new game and calls that method
